verses.roman:
śravasoḥ kuvalayam akṣṇor añjanam
uraso mahendra-maṇi-dāma
vṛndāvana-ramaṇīnāṁ maṇḍanam
akhilaṁ harir jayati

synonyms: śravasoḥ—of the two ears; kuvalayam—blue lotus flowers; akṣṇoḥ—of the two eyes; añjanam—ointment; urasaḥ—of the chest; mahendra-maṇi-dāma—a necklace of indranīla gems; vṛndāvana-ramaṇīnām—of the damsels of Vṛndāvana; maṇḍanam—ornaments; akhilam—all; hariḥ jayati—all glories to Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa.
translation: "Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa is just like a bluish lotus flower for the ears; He is ointment for the eyes, a necklace of indranīla gems for the chest, and universal ornaments for the gopī damsels of Vṛndāvana. Let that Lord Śrī Hari, Kṛṣṇa, be glorified."
